DOCNAME: CASE OF DE SALVADOR TORRES v. SPAIN
TEXT: CARDINAL . ORG The applicant , Mr PERSON , was born in DATE and is resident in GPE .

CARDINAL . ORG In DATE , in his capacity as head administrator of a public hospital in GPE ( Hospital GPE ) , the applicant made an agreement with a bank to the effect that interest on deposits would be paid at a higher rate than that applicable by law . The applicant arranged for payment into his personal account of the excess amounts corresponding to the difference between the legal rate of interest and that of the additional interest ( extratipos ) paid by the bank on the sums deposited . DATE a total sum of MONEY were thus transferred to the applicant .

CARDINAL . ORG In DATE criminal proceedings were brought against the applicant . By a decision of CARDINAL DATE ( auto de procesamiento ) , GPE investigating judge no . CARDINAL found that the facts established by him disclosed the offence of embezzlement of public funds ( malversación de caudales públicos ) under LAW para . CARDINAL of LAW ( see paragraph CARDINAL below ) , carried out not by a civil servant stricto sensu but by a person entrusted with funds belonging to a public institution ( LAW - see paragraph CARDINAL below ) . The applicant was subsequently committed for trial in FAC . The public prosecutor and the hospital , acting as a private prosecutor , lodged submissions which essentially endorsed the findings of the investigating judge and requested , inter alia , that the applicant be sentenced to DATE imprisonment . ORG ( Abogado del Estado ) , appearing also as a private prosecutor on behalf of the ORG finances , submitted that the facts of the case constituted the offence of corruption of a civil servant .

CARDINAL . ORG In a judgment of CARDINAL DATE , ORG , held that , although the applicant fell into the category provided for in LAW , the sums embezzled by him were not " public funds " and , accordingly , Article CARDINAL para . CARDINAL was not applicable . It further held that , owing to his particular personal status in the hospital , the applicant could not be considered a civil servant stricto sensu . It therefore dismissed the charges of corruption . The applicant was nonetheless convicted of the offence of simple embezzlement ( apropiación indebida ) under LAW see paragraph CARDINAL below ) and sentenced to DATE imprisonment pursuant to ORG and CARDINAL para . CARDINAL of LAW ( see paragraphs CARDINAL below ) . ORG did not find any aggravating circumstance of general application ( see paragraph CARDINAL below ) .

CARDINAL . ORG The public prosecutor and the hospital appealed on points of law . They described the amounts in question as public funds and again requested the applicant 's conviction for the offence of embezzlement of public funds under Articles CARDINAL para . CARDINAL and CARDINAL of LAW . In his submissions , the public prosecutor stressed the fact that FAC had clearly acknowledged that the applicant was a person entrusted with funds belonging to a public institution for the purposes of LAW .
CARDINAL . ORG The applicant did not appeal , thereby accepting the facts as established by ORG , their legal classification and the sentence .

CARDINAL . ORG In CARDINAL subsequent decisions of CARDINAL DATE , ORG ) found that , although the sums embezzled could be considered public , the offence under Article CARDINAL para . CARDINAL did not apply since the hospital was not legally entitled to those sums . Contrary to FAC , ORG further held that :

In any event , it is true that , even if LAW ( embezzlement of public funds ) can not be applied , the fact remains that the accused Mr GPE is a civil servant and that he took advantage of his position in order to commit the offence of which he was found guilty . Therefore , ... the aggravating circumstance in LAW para . CARDINAL must be applied . To put it in a graphic manner : if the offence of embezzlement of public funds can not apply due to the lack of the objective element , the aggravating circumstance must apply given the offender 's legal position . "

ORG therefore quashed the judgment being appealed and convicted the applicant of the offence of simple embezzlement with the aggravating circumstance that he had taken advantage of the public nature of his position in performing the duties entrusted to him ( Article CARDINAL para . CARDINAL of LAW - see paragraph DATE below ) . In doing so , ORG considered that a request to apply this aggravating circumstance could be inferred from the public prosecutor 's submissions ( see paragraph CARDINAL above ) . In the exercise of its powers ( see paragraph CARDINAL below ) , ORG sentenced the applicant to DATE imprisonment , the maximum term of imprisonment for the offence of embezzlement under the rules for the determination of sentence set forth in LAW para . CARDINAL of LAW ( see paragraph CARDINAL below ) .

CARDINAL . Mr de PERSON filed an amparo appeal in ORG ) . He asserted that he had not been informed of all the components of the charge against him and that , accordingly , his right to a fair trial had been violated ( LAW - see paragraph CARDINAL below ) . By a decision ( auto ) dated DATE , the appeal was declared inadmissible on the ground that it did not disclose any relevant issues of constitutional law . ORG found that the applicant was well aware that the charges against him presupposed not only that the offender 's position was equivalent to that of a civil servant , but also that he had taken advantage of that position in the commission of the offence . He had therefore had the possibility to address that issue throughout the proceedings and his defence rights had not been forfeited .
CARDINAL . ORG According to LAW :

" CARDINAL . Everyone has the right to effective protection by the judges and courts in the exercise of his rights and his legitimate interests and in no circumstances may there be any denial of defence rights . CARDINAL . Likewise , everyone has the right ... to be informed of the charge against him , to have a ... trial ... attended by all the safeguards , to adduce the evidence relevant to his defence ,
CARDINAL . ORG By LAW :

" Any civil servant who embezzles or suffers others to embezzle public funds or other property entrusted to his care by virtue of his office shall be liable to : ... CARDINAL . a term of imprisonment ranging from DATE and DATE to DATE ( reclusión menor ) if the amount embezzled exceeds MONEY . ... In all cases , the offender shall also be permanently disqualified from public office . "
CARDINAL . ORG By LAW , the foregoing provision also applies to :

those entrusted , in any capacity whatsoever , with funds ... belonging to provincial or municipal authorities or to educational establishments or charitable organisations , and to administrators or depositories of funds ... deposited by a public authority , even if they belong to individuals " .

According to the case - law , the offender must not only be a civil servant or a person entrusted with sums belonging to a public institution , he or she must also have taken advantage of that position .
CARDINAL . ORG By virtue of LAW

" Anyone who , to the detriment of others , appropriates or embezzles money , assets or any other personal property , entrusted to his care as depository , agent or administrator , or in any other capacity carrying the obligation to deliver or return the property , or denies having received such property shall be liable to the penalties laid down in LAW
CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL , in so far as relevant , provides as follows :

A person convicted of this offence shall be liable to a term of imprisonment ranging from DATE and DATE ( arresto mayor ) if the sum involved exceeds MONEY . If there are found to be CARDINAL or more of the aggravating circumstances provided for in LAW below or one especially aggravating circumstance , the person convicted shall be sentenced to a term of imprisonment ranging from DATE and DATE to DATE ( prisión menor ) ... Where only one of the aggravating circumstances referred to in LAW is found to be established , the term of imprisonment shall be in the range of the maximum sentence available ( grado máximo ) [ from DATE and DATE to DATE ] . "
CARDINAL . ORG By LAW
" The following circumstances shall be deemed to be aggravating circumstances for the purposes of the preceding Article :
CARDINAL . Where the offence is particularly serious in terms of the sum embezzled . "

CARDINAL . ORG In order to determine the sentence , where a particular offence is punished with a term of imprisonment , this can be divided in CARDINAL identical periods ( grados ) : minimum , medium and maximum . If a court finds that no mitigating circumstances and CARDINAL aggravating circumstance can be established , it shall impose a medium or maximum sentence . Where CARDINAL aggravating circumstances are established , the maximum sentence shall be imposed ( LAW ) .

CARDINAL . Aggravating circumstances can be specific to a particular offence ( see , for example , paragraph CARDINAL above ) or of a general nature . LAW describes the aggravating circumstances which can be applied to any offence :
" The following are aggravating circumstances :
CARDINAL . the fact that the offender has taken advantage of the public nature of his or her position . "

CARDINAL . ORG Where ORG finds that an appealed decision is in breach of the law , it will quash it and set it aside and render a new decision on the merits . In doing so , the only restriction on the court is not to pass a heavier sentence than the one which would correspond to the prosecutor 's request ( LAW ) .

CARDINAL . ORG As with any court , ORG has the power to depart from the legal classification given by the prosecution provided that : ( a ) the criminal intent in the offence found applicable is essentially identical to that in the offence as charged ( " delitos homogéneos " - for instance homicide and parricide ) ; ( b ) no different facts are taken into consideration ; ( c ) the new classification leads to the imposition of a sentence that is less severe than that requested by the prosecution . These powers have been considered constitutional by ORG in , among others , its judgments of CARDINAL DATE ( CARDINAL/CARDINAL ) , CARDINAL DATE ( CARDINAL ) and DATE ( CARDINAL ) . The new legal classification may involve the finding of aggravating circumstances that are implicit in the original characterisation ( ORG , ORG , judgment of DATE , PERSON no . CARDINAL , p.
